availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert Spotswood Goodall (Jefferson County, Kentucky, ship captain.)

body.p: Jefferson County, Kentucky, ship captain. Monroe County, Kentucky, native. Son of Peter Copeland Goodall and Adeline Butler Anderson Goodall. Married to Martha Ann Pearce Goodall in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on March 7, 1839. Father of Mary Goodall and Henrietta Goodall. Married to Emily Scott Goodall in Jefferson County on December 22, 1852. Father of Helen H. Goodall. Ship pilot in Jefferson County in 1850. Boat captain in Jefferson County in 1860. Employed Julia McDermin as a servant in Jefferson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, District 3, p. 297A-B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 6, p. 380.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Gillmans, p. 309B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film #000482706, p. 72.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film #000482707, p. 178.
"Mrs. Emily S. Goodall Dead." Courier-Journal (Louisville, KY), May 18, 1912, p. 7.
"Robert Spotswood Goodall (1815-1887)," Find A Grave, Memorial #83446626, accessed April 12, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/83446626
